To me biggest problem with the plot is feeling insecure and having doubt doesn't mean picking any other guy you can see. But as SchrodingerZ said, we are not here to question the reasonableness of the plot, that will make this work and many others seem meaningless.

The thing about why childhood friend got that curse of being the losing heroine (unless the game is fixed like OsaMake) is because the couple already got a very comfortable relationship. Even if both secretly wants it, the choice of trying to advance to the next stage is either they become lovers, or the relationship became awkward after, because they now know the person they like is not in the same page, and for the other side it became very uncomfortable because they realized that person wanted more of something they don't intend to. That's the typical reason in romcom why they can't take the step, the cost for failure is too big. And even if they succeed, then there's a pressure from the label (as "boyfriend"/"girlfriend") to change how they interact with each other. So in the end they choose to stay at the current distance.

@SchrodingerZ I would say its just personality. If it was me I will probably have gave my final warning long ago like "How fucking long are you gonna make me wait", but I guess there do exist such people who would think "Why is he/she still hesitating, am I not good enough?" But yeah I agree with you in real life someone with such low self-esteem probably have a traumatising childhood to cause them to think that way. Given the long relationship between the two this seems very unrealistic.

But yeah I get it this is not the most popular kind of storyline people expect. Man if I want a lesson on relationship it wouldn't be coming from Hentai.

When you think about it nobody wins in the Childhood friends story. The guy gets'a cucked for 5 minutes and decidedly moves on. Chadrone thinks he's won but he really hasn't. The girl settles and tells herself it's for the best. No one's feelings are addressed as in a typical NTR where the cuck just willows in misery, the chick gets broken and Chadrone wins overall. None of that shit happens, it's a future NTR or romance manga waiting to happen.

Well, she's tired waiting and that other guy gave her what she wants, someone who would express they want her, even if it's just a lie. The last chapter is story from her side, should take place between page 86-87. The male childhood friend is actually popular, which is a factor of why she thought of giving up and let her first love fade away. Quoting another light novel review, it's typical of youth romcom story, everyone got their own feeling, it goes different way from each other, and they are thinking of what would happen if they speak it out. Well, overseas readers seems just think "communication!" as it's easy, and "look for specialist help!" against many problems while they want to look for their own answers.
